summary: Most of the pavement on our nation's highways—covering about 220,000 miles of roads—is in good or fair condition. But highway pavement is less likely to be in good condition in urban areas, localities with higher family poverty rates, and areas with higher percentages of underserved racial and ethnic populations. title: National Highways: Analysis of Available Data Could Better Ensure Equitable Pavement Condition
